org.mongodb.operation

Class MapReduce

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mongodb.operation.MapReduce

  • public class MapReduce
extends Object
    A class that groups arguments for a map-reduce operation.

    This class follows a builder pattern.


    MongoDB Doc Links
    • Map-Reduce

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapReduce

        public MapReduce(Code mapFunction,
         Code reduceFunction,
         MapReduceOutput output)
        Constructs a new instance of the MapReduce with output to a another collection.
        Parameters:
        mapFunction - a JavaScript function that associates or “maps” a value with a key and emits the key and value pair.
        reduceFunction - a JavaScript function that “reduces” to a single object all the values associated with a particular key.
        output - specifies the location of the result of the map-reduce operation.

      • MapReduce

        public MapReduce(Code mapFunction,
         Code reduceFunction)
        Constructs a new instance of the MapReduce. Operation will be performed in memory and the resulting documents will be returned as a part of the response to the command call without storing them in third-party collection.
        Parameters:
        mapFunction - a JavaScript function that associates or “maps” a value with a key and emits the key and value pair.
        reduceFunction - a JavaScript function that “reduces” to a single object all the values associated with a particular key.

    • Method Detail

      • finalize

        public MapReduce finalize(Code finalize)
        Add a finalize function to the command.

        The finalize function receives as its arguments a key value and the reducedValue from the reduce function. Be aware that:

        • The finalize function should not access the database for any reason.
        • The finalize function should be pure, or have no impact outside of the function (i.e. side effects.)
        • The finalize function can access the variables defined in the scope parameter.
        Parameters:
        finalize - a JavaScript function
        Returns:
        the same MapReduce instance as used for the method invocation for chaining

      • filter

        public MapReduce filter(Document filter)
        Add a filter to the command. It specifies the selection criteria using query operators for determining the documents input to the map function.
        Parameters:
        filter - the selection criteria document.
        Returns:
        the same MapReduce instance as used for the method invocation for chaining

      • sort

        public MapReduce sort(Document sortCriteria)
        Sorts the input documents. This option is useful for optimization. For example, specify the sort key to be the same as the emit key so that there are fewer reduce operations. The sort key must be in an existing index for this collection.
        Parameters:
        sortCriteria - sort criteria document
        Returns:
        the same MapReduce instance as used for the method invocation for chaining

      • scope

        public MapReduce scope(Document scope)
        Add global variables that will be accessible in the map, reduce and the finalize functions.
        Parameters:
        scope - scope document
        Returns:
        the same MapReduce instance as used for the method invocation for chaining

      • limit

        public MapReduce limit(int limit)
        Specify a maximum number of documents to return from the input collection.
        Parameters:
        limit - limit value
        Returns:
        the same MapReduce instance as used for the method invocation for chaining

      • jsMode

        public MapReduce jsMode()
        Add a 'jsMode' flag to the command.

        This flag specifies whether to convert intermediate data into BSON format between the execution of the map and reduce functions

        Returns:
        the same MapReduce instance as used for the method invocation for chaining

      • verbose

        public MapReduce verbose()
        Add a 'verbose' flag to the command.

        This flag specifies whether to include the timing information in the result information.

        Returns:
        the same MapReduce instance as used for the method invocation for chaining
